alert.note: Alert for Dorchester; Somerset; Wicomico (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 10:06PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTH CENTRAL SOMERSET... WICOMICO AND CENTRAL DORCHESTER COUNTIES THROUGH 1045 PM EDT... At 1006 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles north of Deal Island, or 15 miles northwest of Princess Anne, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, nickel size hail, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Hebron around 1025 PM EDT. Salisbury, Fruitland, and Salisbury University around 1030 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Green Hill, Catchpenny, Wetipquin, Waterview, Trinity, Salisbury-Wicomico, Royal Oak, Eden, Allen, and Whitehaven. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for southeastern Maryland.
